Description: Black-topped brown ware bowl with round base made of very fine Nile silt; interior black; both surfaces well burnished to fine lustre.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Badari, el-, Grave or pit 5459
Curator's comments: One of five pots found in a heap, inverted on top of a mat, within a hole in cemetery 5700. See Burnton and Caton-thompson 1928: p. 13. MArked 5459 on side in pencil, but does not match description in publication for BB69p, Possibly this drawing is simply inaccurate.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 13; pl. xiii. BB69p) (?)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
